de.unistuttgart.vis.wearable.os.sensors

Class Sensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unistuttgart.vis.wearable.os.sensors.Sensor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable

    public class Sensor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Externalizable
    Administrates the parameters of a hardware Sensor. Holds the recent values of the Sensor. Every hardware Sensor is represented by one Sensor object.
    Author:
    pfaehlfd
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sensor

        public Sensor()
        Empty constructor needed for serialization This constructor shall never be called otherwise

      • Sensor

        public Sensor(IGarmentDriver sensorDriver,
              int sampleRate,
              int savePeriod,
              float smoothness,
              java.lang.String displayedSensorName,
              SensorType sensorType,
              java.lang.String bluetoothID,
              MeasurementSystems rawDataMeasurementSystem,
              MeasurementUnits rawDataMeasurementUnit,
              MeasurementSystems displayedMeasurementSystem,
              MeasurementUnits displayedMeasurementUnit)
        Creates a new Sensor, assigns the given values and adds the Sensor to the SensorManagers sensor list. The new Sensor will have the lowest external sensorID, which is not forgiven yet. Use only for external Sensors

      • Sensor

        protected Sensor(android.hardware.Sensor sensor,
                 int sampleRate,
                 int savePeriod,
                 float smoothness,
                 java.lang.String displayedSensorName,
                 SensorType sensorType,
                 MeasurementSystems rawDataMeasurementSystem,
                 MeasurementUnits rawDataMeasurementUnit)
        Creates a new Sensor, assigns the given values and adds the Sensor to the SensorManagers sensor list. The new Sensor will have the same sensorID as in Android. (see android.hardware.Sensor http://developer.android.com/reference/android/hardware/Sensor.html) Use only for internal Sensors

      • Sensor

        protected Sensor(int gpsSensorID,
                 int sampleRate,
                 int savePeriod,
                 float smoothness,
                 java.lang.String displayedSensorName,
                 SensorType sensorType,
                 MeasurementSystems rawDataMeasurementSystem,
                 MeasurementUnits rawDataMeasurementUnit)
        Creates a new GPS Sensor, assigns the given values and adds the Sensor to the SensorManagers sensor list. Use only for internal GPS Sensors

    • Method Detail

      • isInternalSensor

        public boolean isInternalSensor()
        returns if the sensor is an internal Sensor.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        returns if the sensor is enabled.

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean newValue)
        sets the enabled status to the given value. => enables or disables the sensor

      • addRawData

        public void addRawData(SensorData sensorData)
        adds tje given sensorData to rawData. If rawData > savePeriod the data will be saved to the Storage and rawData will be cleared.

      • getRawData

        public java.util.Vector<SensorData> getRawData()
        returns the actual rawData of the Sensor, which is not saved to the storage yet.

      • getRawData

        public java.util.Vector<SensorData> getRawData(java.util.Date time,
                                               boolean plusMinusOneSecond)
        returns the rawData from the given timestamp to the millisecond exact. Or, if plusMinusOneSecond = true the rawData from the given timestamp plus minus 1 second.

      • getRawData

        public java.util.Vector<SensorData> getRawData(java.util.Date begin,
                                               java.util.Date end)
        returns the rawData between the two given timestamps including the given times themselves, either from the database or from the actual rawData or both. Depending of the given timestamps.

      • getSensorDriver

        public IGarmentDriver getSensorDriver()
        Get the sensor driver for the given sensor
        Returns:
        the sensor driver or null if not set

      • getRawData

        public java.util.Vector<SensorData> getRawData(int numberOfValues,
                                               boolean loadFromStorage)
        Returns the given number of the newest SensorData of the Sensor.
        Parameters:
        numberOfValues - the number of SensorData to be returned
        loadFromStorage - true if the Data can also be from the storage and hasnt to be "live"
        Returns:
        the newest SensorData of the Sensor

      • setRawDataMeasurementSystemAndUnit

        public void setRawDataMeasurementSystemAndUnit(MeasurementSystems rawDataMeasurementSystem,
                                               MeasurementUnits rawDataMeasurementUnit)
        sets the rawDataMeasurementSystem [e.g. METRICAL] and the rawDataMeasurementUnit [e.g. KILO] of the Sensor The rawDataMeasurementUnit has to fit to the rawDataMeasurementSystem! so KILO and METRICAL is legal! and KILO and ANGLOSAXON is illegal!
        Parameters:
        rawDataMeasurementSystem - a MeasurementSystems element
        rawDataMeasurementUnit - a MeasurementUnits element

      • toParcelable

        public PSensor toParcelable()
        Create a parcelable Sensor object from the given Sensor for internal use
        Returns:
        the parcelable object

      • toParcelableAPI

        public PSensor toParcelableAPI()
        Create a parcelable Sensor object from the given Sensor
        Returns:
        the parcelable object
